items.title: Aston Villa looking for 10th consecutive win and Afcon begins ‚Äì matchday live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Discussion, news and buildup to all Sunday‚Äôs action ‚öΩ Live scores | Tables | Saturday‚Äôs reports | Mail us here There‚Äôs some interesting debate raging below the line about the tempestuous meeting between Tottenham and Liverpool last night, where Xavi Simons and Cristian Romero were sent off but Micky van de Ven, whose challenge ended Alexander Isak‚Äôs involvement was not. Thomas Frank was certainly of the view that Simons sending off was unjust. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like those types of red card because I think the game is gone if that‚Äôs a red card,‚Äù he told the BBC soon after the game finished. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a reckless tackle. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs exceptional force. We have the referee‚Äôs call and that was a yellow, so that‚Äôs why I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs a red.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: VI Live: PSV jaagt in Utrecht op Eredivisierecord, nog geen grote kansen
items.summary: PSV sluit zondag het jaar af met een uitwedstrijd tegen FC Utrecht. Om 12.15 uur is de aftrap van het duel. Volg de ontmoeting tussen Utrecht en PSV in deze VI Live.

items.title: VI Live: Den Bosch en Vitesse trappen volle voetbalzondag af
items.summary: Naast de duels van PSV en Feyenoord die we in een apart liveblog volgen, staan er nog drie Eredivisie-duels op het programma. Daarnaast wordt er ook volop gevoetbald in het buitenland. In deze VI Live blijf je daarvan volledig op de hoogte.

items.title: Het bizarre 2025 van Youri Baas: 'Alles wat je kunt noemen, is gebeurd'
items.summary: Ajax sloot 2025 zaterdagavond af met een turbulent gelijkspel tegen NEC: 2-2. De wedstrijd in De Goffert ging alle kanten op, met goede momenten, maar ook heel veel chaos en fouten. Wat dat betreft was het een treffende samenvatting van het kalenderjaar van Ajax, en Youri Baas, vol pieken en dalen: 'Het is bizar eigenlijk. '

items.title: Bosz bespreekt transfersituatie Veerman, Schreuder wil Sano houden
items.summary: We zitten in het intermezzo tussen de zomer- en winterwindow, toch druppelt er in het najaar vaak nog een aantal transfers binnen. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: Mauro haalt race tegen de klok, Perisic weer basis: dit is de opstelling van PSV
items.summary: Trainer Peter Bosz moet puzzelen voor de laatste competitiewedstrijd van PSV dit kalenderjaar. Basisspelers Ismael Saibari en Anass Salah-Eddine ontbreken bij de koploper van de Eredivisie vanwege de Afrika Cup. Mauro J√∫nior zit op de bank.

items.title: Where did England go wrong in dismal bid to regain Ashes?
items.summary: England's bid to regain the Ashes is over after three comprehensive defeats in the first three Tests of the five-match series in Australia, but where did it all go wrong for Ben Stokes' side?

items.title: Wilson talks Deadline Day Leeds drama, goalscoring form - and contract talks
items.summary: He's one of the most in-form players in the Premier League players, but this season could have looked very differently for Harry Wilson.

items.title: Kings or kingmakers? Villa entering decisive run
items.summary: Aston Villa have won nine straight matches to emerge as title contenders despite a poor start to the season. Could 2026 be their year?

items.title: ‚ÄòI made such a bond‚Äô: Jesse Lingard on life in South Korea and his next challenge
items.summary: Former Manchester United player discusses culinary and cultural surprises, feeling more mature and how he learned Korean Jesse Lingard says his Korean is decent, good enough to make himself understood when out for dinner and the shocks do not stop there. The former Manchester United and England midfielder was always going to throw himself into his K-League adventure with FC Seoul and now that it is over after two years, a new chapter beckoning when the January transfer window opens, the 33-year-old certainly has the tales to tell. It was the little things as much as anything else, the cultural quirks. And the bigger ones, of course ‚Äì such as the time he watched an octopus squirm in front of him before eating it. ‚ÄúThe food is different, obviously, and I tried live octopus,‚Äù Lingard says. ‚ÄúIt was moving. I was scared at first but it was all right.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: ‚ÄòWe feel excluded‚Äô: expensive tickets and Trump‚Äôs shadow dampen World Cup excitement in Mexico
items.summary: The feeling among fans is anticlimatic as ‚Äòbusinessmen have appropriated the ball that used to belong to the people‚Äô Jonathan Zamora was seven years old the last time Mexico hosted the World Cup in 1986. ‚ÄúI witnessed perhaps one of the most sublime moments in the history of football,‚Äù he says, retelling a story that has become a pillar of his life. Zamora, a Mexican football fan, does not remember how his father, Antonio, got tickets to the 1986 World Cup quarter-final between Argentina and England at the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City. But he does clearly remember the goals: first when Diego Maradona used his ‚Äúhand of God‚Äù to push the ball past England goalkeeper Peter Shilton. And then the ‚Äúgoal of the century‚Äù, where the Argentinian went on a slalom run, dribbling past half the England team before scoring. Continue reading...

items.title: Bears stun Packers for overtime win, brawl mars end to Eagles' title clincher
items.summary: Caleb Williams threw a 46-yard touchdown pass to DJ Moore in overtime, and the Chicago Bears overcame a 10-point deficit late in the fourth quarter Saturday night for a 22-16 win over the Green Bay Packers, who lost quarterback Jordan Love to a concussion.

items.title: AJ: I had to decide if I wanted to carry on boxing
items.summary: Anthony Joshua admits he needed time to decide if he wanted to carry on boxing after his knockout defeat to Daniel Dubois in 2024. The answer? He does.

items.title: Mbapp√© equals Ronaldo record, hits 'Siu' celeb
items.summary: Kylian Mbapp√© added his name to another line in the record books on Saturday, tying Cristiano Ronaldo for the most goals by a Real Madrid player in a calendar year.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal unfazed by Man City title charge
items.summary: Mikel Arteta said Arsenal were not distracted by Manchester City moving top of the Premier League before the Gunners reclaimed number one spot hours later with a 1-0 win at Everton.

items.title: 'I'm not a clown': Sevilla boss blasts red-card ref
items.summary: Sevilla coach Matias Almeyda blasted referee Alejandro Mu√±iz after being shown a half-time red card during the team's 2-0 LaLiga defeat at Real Madrid, saying "I'm not a clown in a circus."

items.title: Isak injured while scoring in Liverpool win at Spurs
items.summary: Liverpool forward Alexander Isak could be facing a lengthy spell on the sidelines after suffering an injury in his team's Premier League clash with Tottenham Hotspur.

items.title: Top and bottom at Christmas - what does it mean?
items.summary: As we approach the halfway point of the season, what do the ghosts of Christmas past tell us about the Premier League title race and relegation battle?

items.title: Isak injury in chaotic Liverpool win gives Slot more problems
items.summary: Liverpool stretch their unbeaten run to six games but Alexander Isak's injury while scoring overshadows win at Tottenham.

items.title: Romero wouldn't have seen red if referee 'did his job' - Frank
items.summary: Cristian Romero would not have been sent off in Tottenham's loss to Liverpool if referee John Brooks "did his job" properly, says Spurs boss Thomas Frank.
